description: In Mexico and the U.S., people celebrate Father’s Day on the third Sunday of June (it is not a public holiday, though). It is an observance to honor fathers and male parental figures in both countries. On this day, people thank all those men who set solid examples and guided them throughout their lives. Don’t miss the opportunity to express your love, appreciation, and gratitude

Pride Month is celebrated each June to honor the 1969 Stonewall Uprising in Manhattan. It commemorates years of struggle for civil rights and the ongoing pursuit of equal justice under the law for LGBTQ individuals. Most people gather together with colorful parades, festivals, picnics, and parties.
*This is a non-federal holiday. It is not officially recognized. For more information about paid holidays please visit Justikia.
